greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of cos(2*Pi/17).
comment: Constant related to the constructibility of the regular heptadecagon. The "Disquisitiones Arithmeticae" of Gauss contains the following equivalent expression:
This value is a root of the polynomial 256*x^8+128*x^7-448*x^6-192*x^5+240*x^4+80*x^3-40*x^2-8*x+1.
reference: C. F. Gauss, Disquisitiones Arithmeticae, 1801 (Lipsia), p. 662 (par. 365).
Ian Stewart, Professor Stewart's Cabinet of Mathematical Curiosities, BASIC Books, a member of the Perseus Books Group, NY, 2009, "Why Gauss Became a Mathematician", pp. 146 - 149.
Ian Stewart, Why Beauty Is Truth, A History of Symmetry, BASIC Books, a member of the Perseus Books Group, NY 2007, pp. 136.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
mathematica: RealDigits[(-1 + Sqrt[17] + Sqrt[34 - 2 Sqrt[17]] + Sqrt[68 + 12 Sqrt[17] - 4 Sqrt[170 + 38 Sqrt[17]]])/16, 10, 111][[1]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 09 2012 *)
results.author: _Bruno Berselli_, Mar 26 2012
